title: 107_hr2558
content: The Act titled "Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001" allows for voluntary early retirement incentive plans for governmental and higher education employees. The Act allows voluntary early retirement plans for educational and higher education employees, with provisions for age-based reduction or elimination of benefits. The Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001 allows supplemental benefits in addition to retirement or severance benefits, with specific conditions for eligibility and timing of retirement election. The Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001 allows supplemental benefits for eligible employees, ensuring fairness in benefit distribution based on retirement age. This amendment applies to voluntary employee early retirement plans in educational institutions. An institution of higher education or an employer found in violation of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 after January 1, 1996 may face consequences. SEC. 3. Retiree medical benefits coordinated with Medicare and other governmental and employer benefit plans; voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies. (a) Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Plans Maintained by Local Educational Agencies.--Amends the Age Discrimination in Employment Act to include voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies as defined benefit plans. (b) Retiree Medical Benefits Coordinated With Medicare Benefits.--Addresses coordination of retiree medical benefits with Medicare benefits. Section 4(l) of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to clarify that it is not a violation for employee benefit plans to alter, reduce, or eliminate medical benefits for retired participants eligible for Medicare. The amendments also apply to voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies. Section 14101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act states that any employee benefit plan providing medical benefits for retired participants in violation of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 after January 1, 1996, may be subject to penalties. The amendment clarifies that no inference should be drawn regarding whether a voluntary early retirement incentive plan constitutes a defined benefit plan for any purpose.
